DataElement.preferredName: Child Immune Response Assessment Description Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A son or daughter of any age, including biological offspring and sometimes including unborn children, adopted children, stepchildren, foster children and children born outside of marriage; person under an age specified by law._1. any response of the immune system to an antigen including antibody production and/or cell-mediated immunity; 2. the response of the immune system to an antigen (immunogen) that leads to the condition of induced sensitivity; the immune response to the initial antigenic exposure (primary immune response) is detectable, as a rule, only after a lag period of from several days to two weeks; the immune response to a subsequent stimulus (secondary immune response) by the same antigen is more rapid than in the case of the primary immune response._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._The words of something written.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A son or daughter of any age, including biological offspring and sometimes including unborn children, adopted children, stepchildren, foster children and children born outside of marriage; person under an age specified by law._1. any response of the immune system to an antigen including antibody production and/or cell-mediated immunity; 2. the response of the immune system to an antigen (immunogen) that leads to the condition of induced sensitivity; the immune response to the initial antigenic exposure (primary immune response) is detectable, as a rule, only after a lag period of from several days to two weeks; the immune response to a subsequent stimulus (secondary immune response) by the same antigen is more rapid than in the case of the primary immune response.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A son or daughter of any age, including biological offspring and sometimes including unborn children, adopted children, stepchildren, foster children and children born outside of marriage; person under an age specified by law.

Concepts.definition: An age group comprised of individuals who are not yet an adult. The specific cut-off age will vary by purpose.

Property.preferredDefinition: 1. any response of the immune system to an antigen including antibody production and/or cell-mediated immunity; 2. the response of the immune system to an antigen (immunogen) that leads to the condition of induced sensitivity; the immune response to the initial antigenic exposure (primary immune response) is detectable, as a rule, only after a lag period of from several days to two weeks; the immune response to a subsequent stimulus (secondary immune response) by the same antigen is more rapid than in the case of the primary immune response.

Concepts.definition: Any immune system response of an organisms to an internal or invasive threat.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._The words of something written.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Description; a statement that represents something in words.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.
